snippet: The location of Mohammad Salman Hamdani’s name on the Sept. 11 memorial suggests “loose connections,” despite his death as an early responder.
abstract: Name of Mohammad Salman Hamdani, volunteer first responder who died during Sept 11 attacks, does not appear on list of fallen first responders at September 11 Memorial in Manhattan; his name appears on panel listing those with loose connection to day's events, despite honors Hamdani has received from New York Police Department and citing of his name in Patriot act as an example of Muslim-American valor; some suspect that his Pakistani roots and Muslim religion have influenced his legacy.
lead_paragraph: The location of Mohammad Salman Hamdani’s name on the Sept. 11 memorial suggests “loose connections,” despite his death as an early responder.

headline.seo: Sept. 11 Memorial Obscures a Police Cadet’s Bravery
headline.main: Obscuring a Muslim Name, and an American’s Sacrifice
headline.print_headline: Obscuring a Muslim Name, and an American’s Sacrifice
